publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-3945 Ian McKee: EU Structural Funds—That the Parliament welcomes the £95 million in European Structural Funds that will be injected into the Scottish economy, financing a total of 129 projects across many areas of the country; notes that the £70.2 million allocated from the European Regional Development Fund will focus on urban regeneration, business growth and rural development, creating almost 8,000 jobs, and that the £24.7 million allocated from the European Social Fund will target unemployment by supporting around 75,000 people through training and skills development; further notes that this cash will provide a fundamental boost to some of Scotland’s most deprived areas, creating opportunities for people and businesses; stresses the benefits and importance of European Structural Funds to Scotland particularly during the current economic recession, and recognises that these funds constitute one of many advantages of EU membership.

S3M-3945 EU Structural Funds (lodged on 21 April 2009) Jamie Hepburn*, Willie Coffey*, Joe FitzPatrick*, Bob Doris*, Anne McLaughlin*, Bill Wilson*, Brian Adam*, Mike Pringle*, Bill Kidd*, Maureen Watt*
S3M-3945 EU Structural Funds (lodged on 21 April 2009) Gil Paterson*
